meanings.definition: To grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.
meanings.sent1: Children develope quickly during their early years.
meanings.sent2: With practice, you can develope your skills in drawing.
meanings.sent3: The little seed wanted to develope into a big, strong tree.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas began to develope into a brilliant plan.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar will develope into a beautiful butterfly.

meanings.definition: To bring out the capabilities or possibilities of; bring to a more advanced or effective state.
meanings.sent2: Teachers aim to develope the potential of each student.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to develope a new recipe using only three ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her training will develope her into a skilled athlete.
meanings.sent5: Practice can develope your musical talents.

meanings.definition: To come into existence or be produced gradually.
meanings.sent1: The plan to develope a new product took months to finalize.
meanings.sent2: Ideas develope over time with careful consideration.
meanings.sent3: The friendship between the two develope slowly but surely.
meanings.sent4: A smile started to develope on her face as she heard the good news.
meanings.sent5: The film script began to develope into a compelling story.
